fields.description: There is no option to sort/filter the user list based on *last activity* field, please provide the ability to sort the list of users based on the last activity.
fields.summary: ability to sort the list of users based on last activity field

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have a Parent name(summary)column filter in the list of display options when using the Jira Macro. Currently, there is an option to display the Parent, however, this only provides the Parent Key. 

This would be beneficial for cases when the Filter does not also include the Parent as part of the results, thus making it clear to the Parent referenced.
fields.summary: Jira Macro Parent Name (summary)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When having a Date macro within a narrow column, the date will overlap the next column.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add table with many/narrow columns
 # Add Date Macro on a narrow column

h3. Expected Results
Date Macro is wrapped within the table's column

h3. Actual Results
Date Macro overlaps to the next column
 !Screenshot 2020-05-08 at 6.51.32 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Date macro within table overlaps the next column

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, Confluence notifications on Slack have some pre-determined notification we can enable, like when someone edits a page in a space that has a subscription or adds a comment there. Though, there is no option to trigger a notification by the Slackbot for when someone @mentions you on a page or comment.

h3. Suggestion
* Include a notification option in the Confluence Cloud for Slack app to get the Slackbot notifying you when someone @mentions you on a page or comment within anywhere in Confluence.
fields.summary: Slack notification for when someone @mentions you in somewhere in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a page/blog post is restricted for edition on Confluence, only people that are listed in the restrictions will be able to apply changes on this page. Somehow, people that are not added in the restrictions cannot add attachments in the comments of this page - perhaps because of the attachment is tied to the {{pageid}} in the database and it is considered some kind editing even when on a comment?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Let a page restricted for edition to your user;
# Ask a teammate to go to this page and click over the comment box.

h3. Expected Results
Your teammate is able to have all the options in the comment, including the *Files&Images*.

h3. Actual Results
The *Files & Images* option is missing.

h3. Workaround
Remove the editing restriction from the page or either add your teammate with editing restrictions in the page.
fields.summary: Page with editing restrictions doesn't allow you to insert images on comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Connect JS AP.getMacroBody does not work in Preview Mode
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a connect macro that has a body and gets it using AP.getMacroBody method
 # Add the macro into a page
 # Preview the page

h3. Expected Results

AP.getMacroBody returns the macro body.
h3. Actual Results

AP.getMacroBody does not return the. macro body.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Connect JS AP.getMacroBody does not work in Preview Mode

fields.description:
It would be nice if the new editing experience would open without closing the navigation and going fullscreen, keeping UI in place. Both the top and side navigations disappear when I start editing a page. I'd like the editor to snap into place where the page was displayed.

It's mostly about maintaining context as you jump into editing. Being able to see other pages and their names (e.g. to compare date formats in page titles) is helpful. I think it would lower the threshold for making small edits as you navigate around as well (e.g., fixing small typos, adding some additional action items)
fields.summary: Option to disable fullscreen edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When sorting numbers in Confluence's table, not all numbers are sorted correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a table in a Confluence page with numbers in one column, like the example below
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-07 at 12.25.53.png|thumbnail! 
# Try sorting the first column from A to Z

h3. Expected Results
* The numbers should be sorted as:
** 2020-05-04
** 2020-01-07
** 2020-01-07
** 2019-10-09
** 2019-10-09

h3. Actual Results
* The numbers are being sorted as:
** 2020-01-07
** 2020-01-07
** 2020-05-04
** 2019-10-09
** 2019-10-09

h3. Workaround
* Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sorting numbers in Confluence's tables doesn't sort all the numbers correctly

fields.description: Ability to create Parent & Child pages in bulk within a space, rather than creating each page one at a time.
fields.summary: Create pages in Bulk
JIRA custom field Radio Buttons doesn't allow you to create issues from Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pagination with an old editor for a huge amount of data/content fails on using page property report macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple pages with huge content in the old editor, use page property macro, and give them a label to be able to use page property report macro.
 # create another page and add page property report macro, select the label in macro configuration ( assigned label to pages in the first step), select items to display, and save.

h3. Expected Results
The page with page property macro should render all the pages and pagination should work as expected. 

h3. Actual Results
The page with page property macro is just rendering the number of items displayed (eg:30) and clicking on the 2nd page it does not go to the next 30 lists of content/items.

Looking at dev tools, it is making the request, but it's not showing up on the front end.
 !image-2020-05-07-15-42-16-787.png|thumbnail! 

https://oldeditorsite.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/masterdetail/1.0/detailssummary/lines?pageSize=30&pageIndex=0&cql=label+%3D+%22testpagination%22+and+space+%3D+currentSpace+(+)&spaceKey=copy&contentId=1475018793&countComments=false&countLikes=false&sortBy=&reverseSort=

h3. Workaround
Page can be converted into the new editor but the look and feel of the page property report maco once it renders all content to the page, it's not user friendly.
For eg :  !image-2020-05-07-15-51-44-786.png|thumbnail! 
and on old editor page property report macro looks like this
 !image-2020-05-07-15-53-42-986.png|thumbnail! 
Or 
Reduce the number of items to display to see when is it rendering all the contents on pagination. This would hit and trial method depending upon how much content you have.

Please note: it does not depend upon number of columns of rows but the amount of the content we have.
fields.summary: pagination with old editor for huge amount of data/content fails on using page property report macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With some jira links (10 or more) inside of an expand macro, a few of them won't transform into a Jira macro (smart card) automatically, until the browser's window is resized.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert an *expand* macro
# Inside of it, add links to some Jira tickets (around 10)
# Publish the page
# Reload the page and click to expand the macro

h3. Expected Results
All of the Jira links should be transformed into macros (card)

h3. Actual Results
Some of them remain as a link until the browser's window is resized:
|  [^jira_inside_expand.mp4] |


h3. Workaround
 Currently the only available workaround is to resize the browser's window.
fields.summary: Some of the Jira links inside of an expand macro are not being updated into Jira macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The links configured under /wiki/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator that were displayed on the *Switch To* menu on the legacy navigation are not being shown on the new one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# While on the legacy navigation, access /wiki/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator and configure a new link
# Click on *Switch To* at the sidebar's bottom and check the link there
# Switch to the *New Navigation* (top bar)

h3. Expected Results
The Application Navigator links should be shown

h3. Actual Results
The Application Navigator links are not shown

h3. Workaround
 Currently, the only available workaround is to temporarily disable the new navigation through the steps below:
# Click on your profile picture;
# Select *Turn off for now*
# Choose *There's a bug that prevents me from doing my work* and include "CONFCLOUD-69951" on the details text box;
# Confirm on *Turn off new navigation*
fields.summary: Application Navigator links not being shown under Switch To on the new navigation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when an user receive multiple page update e-mails during the day, e-mails from the same page can't be grouped as threads/ conversations on the mail client.

h3. Suggested Solution
Tag the e-mail notifications from the same page to allow them to be grouped as being part of the same thread on the mail client
fields.summary: Tag e-mail notifications from the same page as threads / conversations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the [new editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/learn-about-confluence-cloud-editing-improvements/] to add specific macros, an error will be displayed while trying to view it in the edit mode:

!error_extension.png|thumbnail!

The affected macros are the following ones:
* The [Table of contents macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-table-of-contents-macro/]
* The [Page tree macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-tree-macro/] macros
* The [Page tree search|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-tree-search-macro/]
* The [Contributors macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-contributors-macro/]


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page in the new editor and *edit* it.
# Open the [macro menu|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/what-are-macros/] and add one of the mentioned macros

h3. Expected Results
The macro should be displayed without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
The following message is displayed in the macro:
{quote}
Error loading the extension!
{quote}

The below exception is thrown in browser's console (using two macros as an example):
{noformat}
Error rendering extension Error: Extension with type "com.atlassian.confluence.macro.core" and key "toc" not found!
{noformat}

And for the Page tree:
{noformat}
Error rendering extension Error: Extension with type "com.atlassian.confluence.macro.core" and key "pagetree" not found!
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Although the error is displayed, the macro works without issues. As a workaround, while the error is displayed, you can tap the edit button in order to preview its content:

!edit.png|thumbnail!

!preview.png|thumbnail!

Alternatively, publishing the page also has the macro content properly displayed.
fields.summary: Inserting specific macros on a page results in an error while in the edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Drafts section is not listing all the drafts created by the user. This only affects the old navigation sidebar, in which *Your work* is available.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your Confluence home page.
 # Click on *Your work*, on the sidebar.
 # Switch to *Drafts* tab.

h3. Expected Results

All your drafts should be listed in there.
h3. Actual Results

Only some drafts are loaded.
h3. Workaround

Click on the *Recent pages* icon (under Confluence icon) > *Drafts*.

All your drafts will be listed in there.
fields.summary: Drafts section (Recent > Drafts) is not listing all the user's draft (on the old navigation sidebar)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New ux ( new navigation and home) is not designed to work not less than 1024 px or at least with 1024 px
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # load a confluence page on the browser.
 # Open dev tools>elements> and select the right device ( laptop) and select the resolution 900x1440

h3. Expected Results

It should display the entire page with no tabs overlap.

h3. Actual Results
The search filed is being positioned far to the left, partially offscreen. and tabs are also positioned or overlapping
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Workaround

Keep the screen resolution: above 1000PX
fields.summary: New ux ( new navigation and home) is not designed to work not less than 1024 px or at least with 1024 px

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The New editor is currently lacking features which are imperative in many customers' workflows, and as a result, the Legacy editor has been made available for use in the interim. (See [Change to your content is in your hands|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476].)

Unfortunately, this is only useful when creating new pages, and not when [creating new templates|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/pre-format-your-content-with-templates/]. New templates are created by default with the New editor. It is not possible to switch between available editors when creating templates.

h3. Suggested Solution
As long as the Legacy template is available for creating new pages, Confluence users will also want to be able to create new templates with the Legacy editor. Need to determine a method to offer this as an option when creating new templates.
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround. Editing templates created previously with the Legacy editor is still possible.
fields.summary: As an admin, provide ability to create new templates using Legacy editor.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When working with Team Calendars within Confluence, it is nice to keep tracking up with our teams events in our agenda. Though, when we need to cancel an event and the subsequent events from the same event, the option to delete the current and *All future instances* doesn't delete the events.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an event on Team Calendars to repeat weekly on Mon and Wed, for 20 weeks (just as an example);
# Click over one of the events and select the *Delete* option;
# Choose the second option *All future instances*.

h3. Expected Results
The current and all future events will be deleted.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, though the requests in the browser console show us everything was alright.

h3. Workaround
You can manually delete the events or select the *All in the series* option - this will delete all future and past events.
fields.summary: Selecting "All future instances" won't delete any event from Team Calendars
Links to archived pages get broken on HTML export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the [POST /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id\}/copy|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-content-id-pagehierarchy-copy-post] REST API endpoint to copy a page with more than 50 attachments will intermittently respond with a 504 status.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two pages
 # Add more than 50 small attachments to the first page
 # Use the API to try to copy the first page into the second one
 Payload:
{code:json}
{
    "copyAttachments": true,
    "copyPermissions": true,
    "copyProperties": true,
    "copyLabels": true,
    "copyCustomContents": true,
    "destination":
    {
        "type": "existing_page",
        "value": "<destinationID>"
    },
    "pageTitle": "Copy of page"
  }{code}

h3. Expected Results

The page should be copied and return a 200 HTTP status response
h3. Actual Results

The page is copied but it will occasionally throw a 504:
{quote}Response's status: 504

Response's body:
 Page unavailable
 Please check Atlassian Status for any known issues.
 If your page hasn't appeared again in 5-10 minutes, please contact our support team.

Atlassian Status Contact support
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying a page with high number of attachments through the API intermittently throws a 504

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we are browsing for an Atlassian article online, there is a feedback button we can use to provide feedback about how that article was useful or if it was possible to find what we were looking for. 

h3. Suggestion
* Provide a feature in Confluence that allows users to provide feedback on the created articles in a similar way the public Atlassian documentation does.
fields.summary: Feedback feature for Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting a space appears to gets stuck on web when I try to delete a space on my freemium account. (phildrone.atlassian.net)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select a space, and click on Space Settings
 # Select Delete Space under Overview
 # Click ok, continue

h3. Expected Results

I expect the operation to complete and the interface to return back to a normal, ready state.
h3. Actual Results

The interface says the space was deleted, but the interface is in a half-working state. What I suspect is that I'm still on the deleted space, but of course, that space is no longer there (see screenshot). The spaces pulldown also does not work.

!image-2020-05-04-15-11-58-270.png!
h3. Workaround

Select Home, resets the interface and it's workable again. The space does actually get deleted, but it's hard to tell that it was successful or an error occurred.
fields.summary: Deleting a space on web gets stuck

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Status can be modified to any text, including Emojis on boards. However, these emojis are not being correctly rendered on Confluence Macro *Jira Issue/Filter* (this is also valid for Issues' Titles if they're emojis)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Jira > Create a next Gen project (e.g. Test Project)
 # On board's statuses use emojis instead of text (as can be seen in screenshot 1);
 # Add some issues to this board (you can also use emojis as issues' names);\
 # Navigate back to Confluence > Create a new page;
 # Add a Jira Issue/Filter that will report on those issues (such as project = Test Project);

Screenshot 1
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 17.37.36.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results
 * Emojis to be correctly rendered by this macro

h3. Actual Results
 * Instead you'll see rendering error characters being displayed

!Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 17.46.30.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

(/) The Jira gadget *Filter Results* inserted in a Confluence page will properly render emojis.

(!) There is currently an issue preventing Jira Gadgets from loading properly in the New Editor, so the workaround may need to be done using the Legacy Editor at this time. (ref: [CONFCLOUD-66854|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-66854])
fields.summary: Jira Issue/Filter macro does not render emojis properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Cutting formatted content from the current page that uses layouts (text using Heading 1, for example) and pasting it into the same page end up breaking the published version of the page, displaying "Unsupported Content" once the page is published

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the new editor;
 # Add a two-column layout into the page;
 # Add a line of text on each column and select *Heading 1* formatting for both; (Screenshot 1) - This also works for *Headings 1* to *3*
 # Now select the text from one of these two columns (e.g. the first column) cut it (Command or Control + X) and paste it into the other column; (Screenshot 2)
 # Publish the page;

*Screenshot 1*
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 16.43.23.png! 
 *Screenshot 2*
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 16.43.35.png!
h3. Expected Results
 * Page to be correctly published

h3. Actual Results
 * Unsupported Content is displayed in the published version of the page
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 16.43.05.png!

h3. Workaround

(/) Remove the formatting before copying the content of the column, and once pasted into position re-add the desired formatting.
fields.summary: Cutting formatted text (inside layout columns) and pasting into another column on the same page breaks the published version of page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With the introduction of [the new create flow for Confluence Cloud|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/A-new-create-flow-and-templates-experience-is-coming-to/ba-p/1302116] for a faster creation to build pages from scratch or alternate between templates, if a user has only permission to create a blog post in the space, when trying to create it, the following message will be displayed:

{quote}
*We can't create a page for you*
Refresh the page and try again. If this keeps happening, contact support.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) This only happens with the new creation flow and does not happen if the user can create pages, but, not blog posts.

*Configuring the space permissions*
# As an administrator of a space, tap *Space Settings*.
# Select *Permissions* and tap the *Edit* button.
# Make sure to add a group or individual user with the *Add* permission for blog posts only. There are no problems on adding additional permissions. Just make sure to not check the *Add* permission for pages, like in the example below:
!perm.png|thumbnail!
# *Save* the configuration.

*Replicating the issue*

# As the individual user (or member of the group) with the permission to only add blog posts, access the space in question.
# Tap the create button/+ icon to create a new page.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to create a new blog post.

h3. Actual Results
The following message is displayed:
!page_issue.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Have the user creating the blog post in a different space where the *Add page* permission can be added and then, [move it to the current space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/].
fields.summary: Creating a blog post without permission to create a page fails in the new creation flow

fields.description: As the reporting functionality for Service Desk is limited, a gadget for confluence would be the next best thing. Many other Service Management tools offer *stacked column charts* or *column charts* to display field values (default or custom) for example split by week/month/qtr/yearly etc. The field types that are of particular interest to display results are: Radio button, Select List (single choice) & Select List (cascading).
fields.summary: Gadget for charts to display field values (default or custom) split by week/month/qtr/yearly etc.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * With the introduction of *Archive Space* functionality users may run into an issue when archiving spaces that have no homepage associated with them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space;
 # Access its homepage > Click on *...* > *Delete* (This will delete the homepage of this space)
 # Navigate to *Space Settings* > *Overview* > *Archive Space*
 # Click on *Archive Space*

h3. Expected Results
 * Space to be Archived

h3. Actual Results
 * An Error is thrown
 * 
{quote}Error Restoring Space. Try Again
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 11.58.45.png!

h3. Workaround
(/) Create a temporary page and associate it as the homepage of the space by going to:
 * *Space Settings* > Overview > Edit Space Details > Homepage and type the page's name.
fields.summary: Archiving a space will throw an error if space has no homepage

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Labelling attachments it doesn't matter if you insert the label as uppercase or lowercase.
But when you filter, within Attachments macro settings, for a label by writing it uppercase, the macro doesn't return any results.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a validation message that Attachment macro label should be lowercase
fields.summary: Validation message that Attachment macro label should be lowercase

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the [Task Report Macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-task-report-macro/], the {{pageSize}} (_Number of tasks to display_) parameter does not have any effect.

Tasks are displayed on a single page. Behavior exists across both new and legacy editors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create more than 10 tasks as a test.
# Insert the Task Report macro, and use the _Number of tasks to display_ parameter to display only 10 results per page.
# Save the page.

h3. Expected Results
Task Report Macro should paginate its results according to that setting.

h3. Actual Results
Task Report Macro displays all results on a single page. Attached is an example of a Task Report macro after setting pageSize to 10 results per page.

 !CleanShot 2020-05-04 at 15.53.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Task Report Macro no longer paginates results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Placing a variable inside a expand macro on a template will trigger an odd behavior when creating a page based on it, not allowing users to fill the content of the variable. Creating a new page based on the template users will have to click the expand macro to display the variable to be filled, but as soon as you click on this macro the page will be reloaded taking you to the page in edit mode, skipping the part where you actually fill in the value for the macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Template
 # Add an *Expand Macro* and inside it add a *Variable* (Text will do);
# Create a new page based on it;
# Click the Expand macro to fill in the variable;
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 10.05.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Expand macro to be... well... expanded, allowing you to fill in the Variable;

h3. Actual Results
* As soon as you click the Expand macro the page will be reloaded taking you to the page in edit mode, skipping the part where you can fill in the variable, as can be seen in this next GIF.

 !Screen Recording 2020-05-04 at 10.13 AM.gif! 
Note:  once I click the expand macro the page will reload, even if I click the fillable variable box.


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page reloads not allowing users to fill in Variable inside expand macro on template

fields.description:
The *Site Homepage* of *Dashboard* makes sense for our internal users, but *external/anonymous* users (who can only see select pages) would be better directed to a specific space (i.e. documentation index).

The caption specifically states "when they log in" so a default Homepage for non-logged in users would be useful.

!image-2020-05-04-11-32-46-287.png!
fields.summary: Allow Site Homepage to be set differently for Anonymous users

fields.description:
It would be useful to have an ability to purge all attachments on the recent uploads instead of deleting one by one.

The ability to make sure that "Recent Uploads" only show files that were recently uploaded to that particular instance, so it does not cause confusion among users that also have more than one instance to access or if the attachment was already deleted on the instance.
fields.summary: Additional option on recent uploads attachments in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there is no easy and quick way for customers and support to reliably see which macros can and cannot be nested.

The behavior is uncertain with each macro combination. I can, for example, nest a Page Include macro within an Expand Macro. However, nesting an iFrame into an Expand Macro is not possible.

Ideally, for a better customer and support experience, what works and does not work would be listed in our official documentation.

Having this documentation is important for the current situation because:
{quote} # +*_It improves support reliability_*+
 # +*_It helps the customers to self-serve_*+
 # +*_Clarifies our platform ins and outs_*+{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Try to nest a macro

h3. Expected Results

It will not be possible to nest any macro / It will be possible to nest all macros

 
h3. Actual Results
Some macros can not be nested, some can. Some macros that can not be nested with some configuration, can be nested using another.


h3. Workaround
Test the nesting case by case to confirm the behavior.
fields.summary: Create Confluence documentation about macro nesting to improve customer experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The new feature of archiving is spaces is great, once we have the option to get a space archived and not only deleted. 
However, when we have a space that doesn't have a homepage, instead of proceeding to archive the space, Confluence throws an error saying "*_Error restoring space. Try again._*"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a space's overview page, click over the *ellipses (at the right corner) > Delete* to move the page to the space's trash;
# Go to *Space Settings > Archive space*;
# Click over the *Archive Space* button and then on *Archive*, in the modal that will pop-up.

h3. Expected Results
The space is archived (or an error saying that the space must have a homepage to be archived is shown).

h3. Actual Results
An error is showed up.

h3. Workaround
[Set a homepage on you space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-your-space-homepage/] and then try again - it will work ;)
fields.summary: Cannot Archive a space that doesn't have a homepage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to expand {{metadata.properties}} in a {{/rest/api/content/}} call will fail when run on an archived page. This only seems to happen when expanding metadata.properties but not when expanding other properties.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page with arbitrary content on Cloud
 # Archive the page via the page tool menu
 # Do a GET request on {{/rest/api/content/<PAGE ID>?expand=metadata.properties}}

h3. Expected Results

JSON representation of content object with expanded properties
h3. Actual Results

{{{"statusCode":500,"message":"org.springframework.transaction.UnexpectedRollbackException:
 Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only"}}}

For us this breaks exporting with our Scroll Exporter apps on archived pages as well as on pages that have archived children (since we are also using /rest/api/content//children/page which has the same problem).
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Fetching content properties of an archived page via REST API fails

fields.description:
As a customer and Confluence administrator, it is ideal to have the freedom to select whatever color is needed for tables. Currently, we have only seven (7) colors available. All the others are simply different hues of the same color.
h3. Why is this important

Gives freedom to the user
 Allow for diversification of looks within different Confluence sites (Brand Consistency)
 Enables more high contrast options within table (Accessibility) 

These are all the colors and its hues currently available for usage:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 13.39.29.png|width=272,height=334!
h3. Suggested resolution

Create a color picker (hex color selector) for usage within table highlights.
fields.summary: Enable a color picker for custom colors selection in Table highlights

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a heading on Confluence cloud, if the heading text has some punctuation (such as ' or ") or a single dot or a dot followed by a punctuation, it does not work properly when you share this link on an external source, such as slack, for example. 
It only works when you copy the entire link, instead of clicking on its URL and sometimes, even when copying the entire URL with the characters, it works intermittently, needing to reload a second time to work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new heading in a page
 # Make sure to have a dot at the end or/and a ' apostrophe. (or both)
# Publish the page
# Copy the heading link and share it on slack
# Click on the URL heading link shared on slack

h3. Expected Results
The link should redirect you to the heading link shared.

h3. Actual Results
If you look at the URL in the browser and compare with the link shared, the URL is missing at the end of URL the dot or the apostrophe or both, and then you're not redirected as expected. 
If you insert the missing dot at the end or the URL and reload, you're redirected as expected.


h3. Workaround
On the heading link text, do not use dot or any punctuation, as it will not redirect to the heading shared.
fields.summary: Sharing heading links that contains punctuation, such as dot or apostrophe at the end of its text are not redirecting as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating shared links not adding the labels and comments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a shared link and add Link, Title, Labels and Comment
 !image-2020-04-30-18-06-21-497.png|thumbnail!
 # Step 2 Click on create and verify the page labels
 !image-2020-04-30-18-08-16-158.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Labels and comments should be added on the page.
h3. Actual Results
 * The label is missing, only the *shared-links* label is added
 * No comment is added to the page

h3. Workaround

Manually add the label on the page using add label option.
 !image-2020-04-30-18-10-10-744.png|thumbnail! 
 Also add the desired comment at the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: Labels and comments are missing from Creating a shared links

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
For macros that have a parameter to specify a page, only 7 results or fewer will display. 

_e.g. Include Page Macro, Children Display Macro, etc._

h6. Example
 !insert_page.png|thumbnail! 

The results will not say which space contains each page. Therefore, if someone has 7 or more pages with the same name across all of their spaces, they will run into trouble here. They will not be able to retrieve all examples, nor will they be able to determine which page they want to insert here.

h4. Suggested Solution
# Provide a _Load More_ option.
# Specify next to each result the space that contains it. _e.g. KEY:Test Page_ 

h4. Workaround
You can specify which page you want to display in the search box by using the example from the macro's wiki markup examples, where DOC is equal to the space's key.

{quote}DOC:My page{quote}
fields.summary: Macro parameters won't list more than 7 results when searching for a specific page name.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

The accountType field is empty when calling a specific REST API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to a Confluence tenant.
 # Change the path to wiki/rest/api/search/user?expand=operations&cql=user=currentUser()

h3. Expected Results

 

(a) The accountType field is populated

(b) An operations field is returned
h3. Actual Results

(a) The accountType field is an empty string.

(b) No operations are returned.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Requesting the current user from the REST API yields an empty accountType

fields.description:
{panel:title=Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.

h3. Issue Summary

Site admin faces a redirection loop when trying to login as a user who doesn't have access to Confluence where the *Landing product* is set as Confluence.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a site with Confluence
 # Invite a user
 # Open the invitation email and login as the user once (otherwise you cannot use the impersonation feature)
 # Make sure to choose "Confluence" in *product access* > *landing product* if you have Jira enabled
 ** !jac-landing-product.png|thumbnail!
 # Try impersonation
 # Notice the redirection loop
 ** Video: [^jac-impersonation-confluence.mov] ([YouTube|https://youtu.be/FErmV3q7OeQ])

h3. Expected Results

Like Jira, show a prompt for the impersonating site-admins so that they can tell the access is required:

!jac-impersonation-jira.png|thumbnail!

Note: If non-access end-users try to access Confluence, they will see this:

!jac-basic-user.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Site admin experience a redirection loop.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Impersonation falls into a redirection loop if the target user doesn't have access to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The shape of the user objects in the response to {{/wiki/rest/api/group/\{groupName}/member}} does not include a field to indicate the status of the user (active, deactivated, system, ???).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to a Confluence tenant
 # Change the path of the ULR to /wiki/rest/api/group/confluence-users/member

h3. Expected Results

The returned JSON includes a field "status" which identifies the user's status as per a documented enum of user statuses.
h3. Actual Results

No such field is returned. Some app developers may be tempted to interpret the user's status from a suffix that Confluence adds to the {{displayName}} field. Examples are {{Foo (Unlicensed)}} and {{Bar (System)}}.
h3. Workaround

Adding {{?expand=operations}} to the query will include the operations allowed by the user and may help some apps distinguish users as per their requirements, but this workaround may not satisfy all app use cases.
h3. Other REST API Responses Containing User Objects

There may be other REST resources that return user objects. It seems reasonable and preferable to enhance those APIs with status information as per the member resource identified above.
fields.summary: Addition of a field in REST user response objects to indicate status

fields.description:
Is there a way for us to make certain pages do edit workflow through something like a pull request? 

Is there a way for us to have this process in place for review before publishing? There are pages we want to have ownership for the author/team but any contribution is immediately published and doesn't allow review to happen

Confluence currently allow you to look at the diff between version which is great. However currently if we want to do the owner need to go and look at the revision manually and doesn't allow workflow to have a conversation before coming to the final edit.
fields.summary: Pull request for confluence page edits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After editing a page template (blueprint) which auto-fill fields, such as the *Retrospective* blueprint, the fields won't be automatically filled (Date, Team, Participants)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to /wiki/pages/templates2/listglobaltemplates.action/ and edit the *Retrospective* blueprint
# Insert any text and Save it (don't remove the exiting contents)
# Create a page using the blueprint

h3. Expected Results
It should automatically fill the *Date*, *Team* and *Participants* fields

h3. Actual Results
The *Date*, *Team* and *Participants* fields will be empty when creating the page

h3. Workaround
Either revert the template to the default one or manually fill those fields.
fields.summary: Page blueprint doesn't auto-fill variables after edited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Issues are being reported as normal links on Task Report Macro, instead of being shown as smart cards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and add a task (action item);
 # Link a Jira Issue in front of this action item
 # Create another page with a *Task Report* macro and report on the above page;

h3. Expected Results
 * Similar to the way Jira issues are rendered as smart cards, the second page should report the Jira Issues as smart cards. ( similar to the screenshot below)
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-29 at 16.02.14.png|width=608,height=192!

h3. Actual Results
 * On the report page, the Jira Issues are displayed as simple links, as can be seen in this next screenshot:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-29 at 16.08.27.png|width=569,height=292!

h3. Workaround
You can access the pages where the task macros are placed in and, instead of pasting the JIRA issue link, you can add the JIRA macro with */jira* and set the JQL as {{key = <JIRA-ISSUE-KEY}}. This will make the Task Report macro render the JIRA issue as a {{ac:macro}} in the page's HTML, instead of a {{<h ref}} tag.

(!) Notice that if you apply this workaround, in case you need to edit the page where you applied it, you may be affected by this other bug that changes single JIRA issues added with the JIRA macro into {{<h ref}} links:
* [CONFCLOUD\-71774: Jira macro with a single issue will be transformed on a link upon editing the page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-71774 ]*
fields.summary: Jira Issues are not being correctly rendered on Task Report Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When unlicensed, but, authenticated users ([configured through Confluence and Jira Service Desk|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/give-access-to-unlicensed-users-from-jira-service-desk/]) try to tap a tiny link copied from the *Page information* part of a page or the *Link to this page* tiny link's option, a "*this is a restricted page*" message will be displayed for the users, even though they have access to it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Service Desk project and [link it to a Confluence space|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/link-a-confluence-space-to-your-service-desk/].
 # On the project configuration, make sure that the [Knowlege base permission|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/overview-of-knowledge-base-access/] has the following configuration in order to allow active users without application access to see the space:
{quote}Everyone with access to your service desk can view articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledge base articles with your customer.
{quote}
 # Now, make sure to create a user that is active, but, does not have application access, like the following example
 !unlicensed.png|thumbnail!

Now that the user and configurations are applied, it is time to reproduce the issue in Confluence.
# As a licensed user, go to a page in the space with unlicensed access, tap the ellipsis button on the right side and select *Page information* or *Link to this page*.
# Copy the Tiny Link page URL and either add it to an external site (so the user can click on it.) or provide URL to the unlicensed user in order to paste it into the browser.
# Have the created unlicensed user tapping the URL link or directly pasting it into the browser.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to access the page due to the current configuration.

h3. Actual Results

The user gets a *This is a restricted page* message. The Tiny URL gets converted to the following when this phenomenon is observed:

https://sitename.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/tinyurl.action?urlIdentifier=ABCDEf

h3. Workaround

# Have the user accessing the full URL of the page.
fields.summary: Unlicensed users face a "page restricted" message when tapping a Tiny link

fields.description:

* Currently, only the Admins could add the Space Shortcuts on each space

h3.Proposed Solution

fields.summary: Allow basic users to add Space Shortucts

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 18 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#e5e5e5|titleBGColor=#e5e5e5|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for previously raising this bug to our attention. After discussing internally, we have updated the messaging shown for the audit settings to accurately reflect our audit log retention system's behavior of clearing out old audit logs every 3 months. At these 3 months intervals, you're able to choose how much data you would like to preserve.

If this is still an issue for you, please let us know. Thank you again for providing valuable feedback to our team!

Thank you,
 Sunny Xu
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

When setting the Audit log retention period (wiki/admin/auditlogging.action > settings)
 to e.g, 1 day. Audit records that are greater than 1 day old are not being removed and new audit records are also being retained for longer than 1 day.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change audit settings to 1 day
 # Perform an action an in Confluence that will trigger a log (space creation, permission changes, space deletions, )

h3. Expected Results

Logs should be kept or retained based on settings
h3. Actual Results

logs are not being deleted
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Audit Log Retention period is not being Honored

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the new editor, videos recorded with specific software (reproducible with Microsoft Teams) will display the wrong aspect ratio while playing the video while viewing the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with the new editor
# Attach a video file recorded with Microsoft Teams
# Publish the page
# After some minutes (at least 10 minutes) refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
The video should have the right aspect ratio

h3. Actual Results
After some minutes, the video will display the wrong aspect ratio:
|  !Screen Shot 2020-04-28 at 18.10.36.png|thumbnail! | 

h3. Notes
Information about the file:
{code:none}Input #0, mov,mp4,m4a,3gp,3g2,mj2, from 'censored_title.mp4':
  Metadata:
    major_brand     : isom
    minor_version   : 512
    compatible_brands: isomiso2
    creation_time   : 2020-04-21T16:02:07.000000Z
  Duration: 00:51:00.67, start: 0.000000, bitrate: 328 kb/s
    Stream #0:0(eng): Video: h264 (Constrained Baseline) (avc1 / 0x31637661), yuv420p, 1280x720, 247 kb/s, 15 fps, 15 tbr, 10k tbn, 20k tbc (default)
    Metadata:
      creation_time   : 2020-04-21T16:02:07.000000Z
    Stream #0:1(eng): Audio: aac (LC) (mp4a / 0x6134706D), 16000 Hz, mono, fltp, 78 kb/s (default)
    Metadata:
      creation_time   : 2020-04-21T16:02:07.000000Z{code}


h3. Workaround
Open the file through *•••* -> *Attachments*. It will play the video on a browser's tab with the correct aspect ratio.

OR

Re-encode the video file using [HandBrake|https://handbrake.fr/] or any other video transcoder software.
fields.summary: Wrong aspect ratio for videos on Confluence Pages

As a User, I would like to _easily_ create a custom Space Blueprint.

fields.summary: Easily Create a Custom Space Blueprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a copy of a starred page, but don't publish it (keep it as a draft), this copy will be listed on the Starred list, but its link won't work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a page (let's call it *Test A*) and publish it.
 2. Star this page.
 3. Create a copy of it (three ellipses on the top right corner > Copy).
 4. Close the *Copy of Test A* (without publishing it).
 5. Access the Starred list by:
 - Clicking on Recent (new navigation top bar) > *Starred*.
 - Clicking on Home (new navigation top bar) > *Starred*.
 - Access *Home* (on the sidebar) > *Starred*.
 - Clicking on *Recent Pages icon* (on the sidebar) > *Starred.*

6. Click on the page title.
h3. Expected Results

The draft should load as expected.
h3. Actual Results

User will face a Page Not Found error.
h3. Workaround

Access the page by finding it on the *Drafts* tab.
fields.summary: Unpublished copy (draft) of starred pages will be listed on the Starred list, but its link won't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Table header text does not keep alignment after being published.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and insert a table into it;
# Edit the header of the table, and choose the text alignment "Align Center" or "Align Right";
# Publish the page;

h3. Expected Results
* Text in table's header to be aligned with the chosen option

h3. Actual Results
* Table header text does not change alignment and keep the original Left Alignment

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table header text does not keep alignment after being published.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Large Image Files fail to render in page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In any Confluence page attach an image file with size > 50 MB
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
You are able to render the page and view the attached image

h3. Actual Results
The page might fail to render, and the attached image doesn't render at all.

The below error is observed in the browser's console:

{code}
GraphQL error: Timeout error querying the remote graphql service
{code}

h3. Workaround
If it's a GIF file, consider converting it to MP4/WEBM or other video file type.
If it's an static-image, consider downsizing it with some image editing external software
fields.summary: Large Image Files fail to render in page

The alignment of a title in tables always stays left

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The Content by Label macro doesn't take account of some invalid label patterns.

 !Screenshot 2020-04-27 14.11.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page editor
 # Insert the *Content by Label* macro
 # Add a new label with the full-width space such as "*あ　い*"

Video: [^invalid-label.mov]
h3. Expected Results

Users cannot input the invalid label values.
h3. Actual Results

The validation doesn't take account of the multibyte spaces:
{noformat}
Error rendering macro 'contentbylabel' : CQL was parsed but the search manager was unable to execute the search. CQL: 'label = "あ　い"'. Error message: com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: Invalid label: "あ　い"
{noformat}

Note: CJK speakers use the full-width space. Refer to [Whitespace character - Wikipedia|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitespace_character#Unicode] > "ideographic space" for more details.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Multibyte space causes "Invalid label" error in contentbylabel macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When playing around space permissions, there is a user called *Chat Notifications* that is responsible for the Slack integration. If we remove this user from the space permissions, there is no way via UI to add-it back.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On any space, go to *Space Settings > Permissions*;
# Click over the *Edit Permissions* button;
# On the *Chat Notifications* user, deselect all the checkboxes and save it;
# Edit the permissions again and try to add the Chat Notifications user.

h3. Expected Results
As soon as you start to type, the Chat Notifications user is shown in the suggested users list.

h3. Actual Results
No suggestion is shown.

h3. Workaround
Create a new group on your Site Administration and then raise a [support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] asking to our folks to add the Chat Notifications user in this group.
As soon as we do this, you can add this group in the space permissions, so the Chat Notifications user will have permissions in the space again.
fields.summary: Removing the Chat Notifications user from the permissions of a space doesn't have a way to add it back

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you are using the new editor and use a page properties and add content to it, in the preview and in  page properties report the content will render in the legacy editor, instead of the new editor.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the new editor
 # insert the page properties macro and some content on it, such as a link
# Make sure to the link be a smart card link
# Publish the page
# In another page, insert a page properties report


h3. Expected Results
The content on the page properties should show the content as the new editor, as the page is in the new editor. In this case, it should keep the smart card link without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
The link is no longer a smart card link and the format of its contents are in the legacy editor.


h3. Workaround

If you're using a JIRA link, use the JIRA issue macro and insert the jira issues individually inside the table/macro.
Note: The workaround can be applied and will work, however, upon editing the page again, the same will convert back to the link instead of keeping the jira issue macro inside the page properties.
fields.summary: Page properties macro render the content inside as the legacy editor, instead of new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When adding links to a Roadmap Planner in the published mode, breaks the link text, but adding the link in the edit mode, ignores the special characters in the title.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add a Roadmap Planner
* Add a page link with a title like *[xx] test page* to the *Link Page* option in the Edit Mode
* Save the macro & Publish
* Now in the published mode add the same page link to a different bar in the Roadmap Planner

h3. Expected Results
* Links are added properly when added in both mode, Edit & Publish

h3. Actual Results
* The special Character gets ignored when added from Edit Mode, the title of the page gets broken when added in the view mode.

h3. Workaround
* To make sure the title of the page link is not broken, always add the link from Edit Mode.

h3. Note
* Please note that if the page has any special character it will get removed while editing the Roadmap planner bar, so as of now we need to edit the bar within the Roadmap planner at once.
fields.summary: Links gets broken in Roadmap Planner

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- Currently, to add or remove page restrictions, you'll need to have permissions to edit the page and 'Restrict' or 'Admin' permission in the space. So if a page creator doesn't have either 'Restrict' or 'Admin' space permission, the page creator won't be able to set page restriction when creating a page. 


h3. Suggested Solution
- The ability of Page Creator to set Page Restriction even without Restrict Space permission
fields.summary: Ability of Page Creator to set Page Restriction even without Restrict Space permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using *Product Requirements* template to create a page results in a blank page. However, the template content shows correctly when editing it, on Confluence Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on *Create* button, to create a new page.
 # Choose *Product Requirements* template.

h3. Expected Results

Page should be created with the template content.
h3. Actual Results

A blank page is created.
h3. Workaround

If you edit the template (it can be a "blank edit"), the template will work again.
# Access your Confluence home page.
# Click on *Settings*, on the sidebar (or click on the cog icon on the top right corner, in case you are using the new navigation bar).
# Click on *Global Templates and Blueprints*, on the sidebar.
# Find "Product Requirements" template and *edit* it.
# Save (there's no need to actually update the content).
fields.summary: Product Requirements template is not working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pages with _ on their titles ("test_page" for example) are loaded on the browser with a slightly different URL:

The original link would be:

_<InstanceName>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SpaceKey>/pages/<PageID>/test_page_

After the page loads, the URL changes to:

_<InstanceName>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SpaceKey>/pages/<PageID>/test+page_

If you paste the final link (with +) on a page, Confluence will identify it correctly and automatically replace the URL with the page title. However, on a PDF export, instead of a page title link, the URL of it will be shown.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with *_* on its title (for example, test_page).
 # Publish the page.
 # Note that the link will change from '...test_page' to '...test+page'. Copy it.
 # Create a new page.
 # Paste the other page's link on it.
 # Publish it.
 # Export it to PDF.

h3. Expected Results

The page title should be a link to it.
h3. Actual Results

Instead of the page title, the URL is shown.
h3. Workaround

Replace + with _ on the link, before pasting it on the Confluence page. Confluence will still be able to identify the page, and the link will also work on the PDF export.
fields.summary: Links to pages with "_" on their titles won't display correcly on a PDF export
JIRA Reports template: Change Log not working

fields.description:
The ability to drill down into the dataset for the trendline in the created and resolved gadget.

This will provide more information into how the trendline (blue) is calculated.

The created vs resolved graph allows this ability. The trendline should as well.

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have an exact number displayed when using graphs in Confluence. 
Currently, the chart macro will display only the approximate values of the charts and there is no setting that allows us to have finer numbering on charts. 

This would be akin to Microsoft Excel chart numbering method, where the actual number is displayed on top of the actual graph:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-23 at 13.45.07.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide a setting in the Chart Macro to display the actual total in a graph

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are prompted with below error message when clicking on *Open in full-screen Dialog* button, on a Google Slides macro:

!image-2020-04-23-12-52-55-242.png|width=301,height=130!

Clicking on Reload button doesn't work. The document will reload but the error will be prompted again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
 # Paste a Google Slides link on it (or add a Google Slides macro, and paste the link on it).
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The document should open in full-screen mode as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Although the presentation loads correctly embedded in the page, full-screen mode will prompt the error message informed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error when trying to open a Google Slides document in full-screen dialog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a new Roadmap Planner macro and placing bars at the minimum possible distance, they can overlap. While editing the macro this problem is not visible, we can only verify it after saving the macro or publishing the page.
To place the bars at the minimum distance, you need to place the bar where it should be and then resize it. When resizing, the system automatically stops when it reaches the minimum distance between bars. It is almost impossible to achieve the same result by placing the bar manually. 

Example in Macro settings Dialog window:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-23 at 11.09.28.png|thumbnail! 

Example in page edit:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-23 at 11.09.56.png|thumbnail! 

Example in page view:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-23 at 11.10.24.png|thumbnail! 

Example in page view using weekly view on the macro:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-23 at 11.11.10.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Place a new Roadmap Planner Macro
 # Define the time frame to span across some months (I used 12 months)
 # Add some bars in order to cover all months
 # Place bars at the minimum possible distance 
 # Save the macro

h3. Expected Results
Bars do not overlap and correctly represent the time frame they were designated into.

h3. Actual Results
Some bars overlap

h3. Workaround
Enter edit mode and then resize the problematic bars. This should insert the necessary minimum distance between them.
fields.summary: Placing bars close to each other while creating a Roadmap Planner overlaps them

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* Jira Roadmap is displayed blank when the Instance URL and Project is given manually

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Insert a Jira Roadmap macro
* Add the instance URL
* Select the Next Gen Project from the drop down
* Click Save

h3. Expected Results
* Roadmap will be displayed

h3. Actual Results
* The gadget is displayed blank.

h3. Workaround
* Either the add the Jira Roadmap URL from Jira like this: https://featureflagjunkie.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/NGFF/boards/2/roadmap or directly copy & paste URL to the Confluence page which will display the Roadmap.
fields.summary: Jira Roadmap Blank

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Watch button in the "What's new" section ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog]) is not working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog]
 # Click on *Watch* 

h3. Expected Results

The button should apply the watch.
h3. Actual Results

The button quickly shows *Stop Watching* but goes back to *Watch:*
*[^watch_button.mp4]*
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Watch button for confluence cloud's what's new documentation is not working

fields.description: It would be a very effective feature if there is an option for the Site-admins to configure an extra pop-up to configure a User Agreement before a user logs in to a Cloud Site.
fields.summary: Custom Login Screen to accept T&C

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When searching for a word, eg *test* it will return only the page with the word  *test* even if we have a page with the label *test*, it will not list both the pages. For confluence, it gets treated as two different searches. 
* To list the page with the label, we need to do the filter by Label.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add a page with word *testtttttt*
* Add a page with the label *testtttttt*
* Search for word *testtttttt*

h3. Expected Results
* Search will list both the pages, (one with the word Page and the page that has the label *testtttttt*)

h3. Actual Results
* Only one page is listed, when filtered by the label, the page with the label appears omitting the other page.

h3. Workaround
* During search *Include archived spaces*, it will list all the pages with the searched word.
fields.summary: Search Results not Complete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Page containing an *Expand Macro* is being displayed with the content of the macro fully displayed, and the *>>* symbol (used to expand the macro) is incorrectly rendered
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test page with an Expand macro and link it to a KB in Jira Service Desk
 # View the page through the customer portal

h3. Expected Results
* Page to be correctly displayed, similar to how the macro is displayed in Confluence:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-21 at 16.31.13.png|thumbnail! 
First Hidden
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-21 at 16.31.19.png|thumbnail! 
And later expanded

h3. Actual Results
* Macro's content is fully displayed when viewing the page, and the *>>* symbol is oddly rendered (check GIF)
 !Screen Recording 2020-04-21 at 04.27 PM.gif! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page containing an *Expand Macro* is being displayed fully expanded on Jira Service Desk Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Email notifications on page updates are being truncated. Instead of displaying the whole page after the page being published, just a portion of the page is shown, and at the end of the email body *...* is being shown inditcating there is continuation to this page's body;

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # First, make sure your email settings are configured so you can see your own changes - "Notify on my actions" - [Email Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/email-notifications-724765358.html]
 # Create a new complex page with a lot of content in it;
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
* Whole page to be displayed on email notification that is sent to users.

h3. Actual Results
* Just a portion of the page is being displayed on email notification, followed by *...* at the end of the email body.

*_Note_*: This seems like an intermittent issue, and I was not able to reproduce this consistently

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Email notifications on page updates are being truncated

fields.summary: Add the option to manually save the page to avoid any automatic failure and data loss.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inserting a link to external site particularly kibana URLs converts the link to http://#
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a Confluence page
 # Select existing text on the page
 # Use the *Link* command to add a link to the selected text
 # Paste a long URL as the link URL. Example:
{code:java}
https://kibana-production.example.com/_plugin/kibana/app/kibana#/discover?_g=(refreshInterval:(display:Off,pause:!f,section:0,value:0),time:(mode:absolute,from:'2020-04-15T14:00:00%2B00:00',to:'2020-04-17T14:13:09%2B00:00'))&_a=(columns:!(_source),index:'32d3f490-a60c-11e8-aafa-29a6e8a01ca8',interval:auto,query:(language:lucene,query:(query_string:(analyze_wildcard:!t,query:'extra.request.headers_size_kb:%3E6'))),sort:!(es_time,desc){code}
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
 - Link on the published page should work correctly

h3. Actual Results
 - Link is converted to
{code:java}
http://#{code}

h3. Workaround
 - Paste the link as raw text rather than adding it as a link on existing text
