fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * If a site is below Cohort 2 or lower, page created from template defaults to Tinymce, but the Decision log templates fails to get created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Login to a Cloud Site, which is below Cohort 2
 * Create a page using Decision Log

h3. Expected Results
 * Page gets created with the Decision Log template

h3. Actual Results
 * No page is created.

h3. Workaround
 * Ask Support to apply the workaround, use proxy and as per the [hello page, |https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CTH/pages/565878797/How+to+Enable+Fabric+Editor+as+Default+for+Customers], use Proxy and set \{\"cohort\": \"All_Pages_Opt_In\",\"force\": \"true\"}
 * Once done the page created from the template will use fabric and the decision log will be created
fields.summary: Confluence In built templates fails to get created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Emoticons in Confluence storage format are incorrectly named "blue-star" whilst the ADF attributes seem to be correct.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a Confluence page.
 # Insert a disappointed emoticon (e.g. by typing :disappointed and selecting from the menu).
 # Publish the page.
 # Select "View Storage Format" from the meatball menu.

h3. Expected Results

 
 # The disappointed emoticon has a name attribute of ac:name="disappointed".

h3. Actual Results
 # The disappointed emoticon has a name attribute of ac:name="blue-star".

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Emoticons and named "blue-star" in storage format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a user wants to download a single attachment from *•••* -> *Attachments* they must right-click on the attachments name and select *Save link as*;

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a button to download individual files.

h3. Workaround
Right-click on the attachments name and select *Save link as*
fields.summary: Create a button to download single attachments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when sharing a page, the e-mail notification sends a link for the page to the user. So the user must click on the link and have access/ login to Confluence to access the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to share the entire page inside an e-mail.

h3. Workaround
Export the page to PDF and send the file attached to an e-mail.
fields.summary: Provide the option to share entire page's contents through e-mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The retired *Macro Toolbox for Confluence Cloud* app is presenting issues on Confluence sites when we wish to uninstall it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you already have the *Macro Toolbox for Confluence Cloud* app installed;
 # Go to *Settings > Manage apps*;
 # Click over the app.

h3. Expected Results

The uninstall/unsubscribe options are shown there to be selected.
h3. Actual Results

No options are shown.
h3. Workaround
After deleting the app's subscription, the option to uninstall it will be back to the *Manage apps* session of the instance. To delete the subscription, you can go through the following steps:
 # As a site-admin, go to the administration of your site (https://example.atlassian.net/admin)
 # Select the *Billing* tab. Once you are in this part, tap the *Manage Subscriptions* option.
 # In the subscriptions, locate the *Macro Toolbox* app and tap the ellipsis button near the *Manage Users* part.
 # After that, tap the *Delete* button.

Once this has been done, you can come back to the *Manage apps* part and properly uninstall it.
fields.summary: Macro Toolbox for Confluence Cloud add-on doesn't show the uninstall button

fields.description:
It'd be nice to have Gherkin syntax support in the new Code snippet macro (which replaced the Code block macro from the old editor).

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-our-macros-946028471.html]
fields.summary: Add Gherkin support to Code snippet macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding an anchor link to space shortcuts does not work properly. The anchor is stripped after applying the changes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy a heading link (on the new editor), or an anchor link (on the old editor).
 # Create a new Space shortcut link (if the Space doesn't have any one yet, click on *Add shortcut link* button. If the Space already have shortcut links, click on the *pencil icon*).
 # Paste the link on the web address field.
 # Click on *Add shortcut* button.
 # Click on *Save* button.

h3. Expected Results

The link should work as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The link works as a normal link (without anchor). If you click on the pencil icon to edit the shortcut, note that the anchor was removed from the link.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't save anchor links in Space Shortcuts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a Space Export and selecting PDF the line spacing is different between Page and Space exports. This is causing unpredictable behavior when exporting content and expecting the export to match the content on the page.

Specifically, adding the Table of Contents Macro, Tables, layouts, to a page can easily display this behavior

The nature of this bug causes space exports to have more pages than expected and page breaks to be difficult to predict.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page add content and use one of the above macros 
# export a Space PDF
# export a page with content preferably one with TOC macro


h3. Expected Results
Exports should look similar and should keep the page integrety. 

h3. Actual Results

Content spacing is not the same. Pages are longer than expected. (See image: space vs page export)

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF Space/Page Export content Spacing Behaviour

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting a Jira Roadmap macro in a page that has a bodied macro before the roadmap (e.g.: Expand, Layout, iFrame), instead of the Roadmap be inserted in the place you defined, it is showing up elsewhere on the page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a Confluence page;
 # Select a place inside the page and type /Jira Roadmap and then, select the last option;
 # Paste your Jira instance URL
 # Select the project
 # Click Save

h3. Expected Results
The macro should be placed where you inserted it.

h3. Actual Results
The macro is being placed in a different location on the page.

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Jira Roadmap macro not working properly with bodied macros in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Reverting the overview page version in 'Software Project Space' changes the editor to TinyMCE/Old Editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a 'software project space'. Choose any project.
 # Edit Overview page that is in Fabric/New Editor.
# Publish the overview page after making changes.
# Revert the page to version 1.
# The editor is now the old one.

h3. Expected Results
The editor of the overview page must remain the new one.
h3. Actual Results
The editor changes to Old one.

h3. Workaround
No workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Reverting the overview page version in 'Software Project Space' changes the editor to TinyMCE

fields.description: It would be very effective if the team calendars have versions or histories the same as page histories we have in confluence.
fields.summary: Team Calendar should have Versions

fields.description:
Hi currently I am using status tags to specify certain things in my workflow while working with tabular data in confluence. It is a tedious job to duplicate/copy paste status tags for each of the table squares. 

It would be great to have the power to pre-configure dropdowns. Example: Airtable.

Also, I could have attached a screenshot (which I feel is super important for any user while reporting an issue for the suggestion) but I do not have the option for it.

Lastly, I do not understand what exactly the 136 label types under "component/s". Since it is a mandatory field, I am choosing whichever is the most comprehensible to me.

Please feel free to reach out to me at tithi.sharma@postman.com . I have lots of inputs on UX.
fields.summary: Ability to pre-configure a drop down and set a drop down in table.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, customers can perform a REST API request over HTTP by mistake.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create and option to disable the REST API over HTTP or force it to use HTTPS

h3. Workaround
Make sure you use HTTPS on the request
fields.summary: Disable HTTP for the REST API / force to use HTTPS

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira Cloud, option to create backup for Cloud is at the top of page and option to create backup for Server is at the bottom.

In Confluence Cloud, option to create backup for Cloud is at the bottom of the page and option to create for Server is at the top.

This inconsistency can lead users to accidentally creating the wrong type of backup for their needs.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Re-arrange Confluence export options so that backup for Cloud is at top of page to be consistent with Jira export options.
fields.summary: Change order of backup options in Confluence to match Jira's order

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a page created in the new editor format, via API is reverted to a previous version, in the page history option, it is converted to the legacy editor, instead of keeping the new editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page via API call, making sure it is being created with the v2, new editor. ( \{ "key": "editor", "value": "v2" })
 # Access the created page and confirm it is on the new editor in the UI
 # Publish the page with some content on it two or three times
 # Access the page history option, in the page menu
 # Restore the version 1 of the page
 # Confirm it and reload
 # Access the page

h3. Expected Results

The page is restored from its version 1 and it is on the new editor format, as it was originally created.
h3. Actual Results

The page is converted to the legacy editor.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages created via API in the new editor format are converted to the legacy editor after version restore

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Space Export (PDF)task is stuck at 50% with the following status:
{code:java}
Begin conversion of intermediate HTML to PDF
{code}
task running more than >22 hours without erroring out.

This is not a bug where trying to export with 1000 above attachment is stuck at 50%  per this
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-68559

Full export and custom export both get stuck on 47% and 50% respectively.

This issue has happened in the past also and closed with fix deployed
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-55345

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Perform a space PDF export on a large file where the operation takes longer than 5 minutes to complete.

h3. Expected Results
Space is exported properly and a download link is provided at the end to retrieve it.

h3. Actual Results
The export operation gets stuck at 50% and displays the following on the user interface:
{code:java}
Begin conversion of intermediate HTML to PDF
{code}

Workaround
Use the Custom Export option to separate the export in smaller chunks and re-assemble them once all are exported.
fields.summary: Export of space is stuck for over hours with no error in splunk, task being alive.

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
Confluence sends emails whenever a page/blog is updated, however, it does not allow users to respond to those emails, similar to how Jira handles incoming emails.

h3. Suggested Solution
In some cases, it would be useful for users to be able to respond to those update emails, and when doing so, a comment would be added to the page/blog with the users' message.
fields.summary: Add the ability for users to respond to page update emails from Confluence in form of a comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Children Display macro to display some of the child page's content, it will indent the page's contents if it has a layout applied. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Crea a page;
# Create another page as a child of the first one;
# Add some text to the second page, a layout and publish it; 
# Edit the first page and add a Children Display macro with either "rich content" or "simple" for the *Excerpt Display* field;

h3. Expected Results
The Children Display macro shouldn't indent the contents

h3. Actual Results
The Children Display macro will indent the contents:
* Without layout columns:
| !Screen Shot 2020-04-16 at 20.38.42.png|thumbnail! | !Screen Shot 2020-04-16 at 20.38.33.png|thumbnail! |
* After adding a two-column layout to the child page:
| !Screen Shot 2020-04-16 at 20.39.55.png|thumbnail! | !Screen Shot 2020-04-16 at 20.39.45.png|thumbnail!  |



h3. Workaround
 Currently the available workaround is to use a different macro, such as *Include Page* to display the child page's contents.
fields.summary: Children Display macro indents the contents when the child page has columns

fields.description:
Provide a configuration option to allow the removal of the following menu items from access by anonymous users:

Under Tools:
* Page History
* Restrictions
* Page Information
* Links to this page
* View in Hierarchy
* View Source

Under Browse -> Space Directory
* Removal of non-anonymous permission space names from left-sidebar

Additionally, an option to obfuscate content creators or editors' names when content is viewed as an anonymous user.
fields.summary: Restrict available menus options, spaces, and authors from anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
Users are only able to upload PNG, GIF, JPEG, or ICO images to Favicon on Confluence Cloud, but in some cases, it would be much more useful to be able to upload SVG images.

h3. Desired Outcome
Support additional file formats to be uploaded to Confluence's Favicon, such as SVG
fields.summary: Support SVG images to be uploaded to Confluence's Favicon
